com.amazonaws.mturk.service.axis
Class RequesterService

java.lang.Object
  com.amazonaws.mturk.service.axis.AWSService
      com.amazonaws.mturk.service.axis.FilteredAWSService
          com.amazonaws.mturk.service.axis.RequesterServiceRaw
              com.amazonaws.mturk.service.axis.RequesterService

public class RequesterService
extends RequesterServiceRaw

The RequesterService class provides a set of APIs and convenience methods to perform Amazon Mechanical Turk operations. It extends the RequesterServiceRaw class.

Most methods throw a ServiceException. This is a generic exception that can occur for many reasons, including:

  • Invalid credentials
  • Insufficient funds
  • Invalid parameter
  • Internal service exception
  • Network problems
You should handle all situations in your application.

Field Detail

DEFAULT_PAGE_NUM

public static final int DEFAULT_PAGE_NUM
The page number of the results set. Default is 1.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE
The number of returned results per page. Default is 10.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_SORT_DIRECTION

public static final com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.SortDirection DEFAULT_SORT_DIRECTION
The direction of the sort. Default is Ascending.

LOAD_ALL

public static final int LOAD_ALL
Specifies whether to load all HITs in a file. Default is no. Use this as the numHITToLoad parameter of createHITs if you want to load all the HITs in the input file.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_ASSIGNMENT_DURATION_IN_SECONDS

public static final long DEFAULT_ASSIGNMENT_DURATION_IN_SECONDS
The amount of time in seconds that the Worker has to complete the assignment after accepting it. Default is 3600 (1 hour).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_AUTO_APPROVAL_DELAY_IN_SECONDS

public static final long DEFAULT_AUTO_APPROVAL_DELAY_IN_SECONDS
The amount of time in seconds before HITs are automatically approved. Default is 1296000 (15 days).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_LIFETIME_IN_SECONDS

public static final long DEFAULT_LIFETIME_IN_SECONDS
The amount of time in seconds that the HIT can be available for Workers to accept. Default is 259200 (3 days).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ABANDONMENT_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID

public static final java.lang.String ABANDONMENT_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID
Qualification type Id for the Worker_PercentAssignmentsAbandoned system qualification. It specifies the percentage of assignments the Worker has abandoned. Use this Id when you create HITs with system qualifications.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

APPROVAL_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID

public static final java.lang.String APPROVAL_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID
Qualification type Id for the Worker_PercentAssignmentsApproved system qualification. It specifies the percentage of assignments the Worker has submitted that were subsequently approved by the Requester, over all assignments the Worker has submitted. Use this Id when you create HITs with system qualifications.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REJECTION_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID

public static final java.lang.String REJECTION_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID
Qualification type Id for the Worker_PercentAssignmentsRejected system qualification. It specifies the percentage of assignments the Worker has submitted that were subsequently rejected by the Requester, over all assignments the Worker has submitted. Use this Id when you create HITs with system qualifications.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RETURN_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID

public static final java.lang.String RETURN_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID
Qualification type Id for the Worker_PercentAssignmentsReturned system qualification. It specifies percentage of assignments the Worker has returned, over all assignments the Worker has accepted. Use this Id when you create HITs with system qualifications.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUBMISSION_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID

public static final java.lang.String SUBMISSION_RATE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID
Qualification type Id for the Worker_PercentAssignmentsSubmitted system qualification. It specifies the percentage of assignments the Worker has submitted, over all assignments the Worker has accepted. Use this Id when you create HITs with system qualifications.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOCALE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID

public static final java.lang.String LOCALE_QUALIFICATION_TYPE_ID
Qualification type Id for the Worker_Locale system qualification. It specifies the location of the Worker from the Worker's mailing address. Use this Id when you create HITs with system qualifications.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

createHIT

public com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.HIT createHIT(java.lang.String title,
                                                   java.lang.String description,
                                                   double reward,
                                                   java.lang.String question,
                                                   int maxAssignments)
                                            throws ServiceException
Creates a HIT, using defaults for the HIT properties not given as parameters.

Default values:

  • ResponseGroup: Minimal
  • LifetimeInSeconds: 3 days
  • AssignmentDurationInSeconds: 1 hour
  • AutoApprovalDelayInSeconds: 15 days
  • Keywords: null
  • QualificationRequirement: null

Parameters:
title - the title of the HIT. The title appears in search results and everywhere the HIT is mentioned.
description - the description of the HIT. The description should include enough information for a Worker to evaluate the HIT before accepting it.
reward - the amount to pay for the completed HIT
question - the data the Worker uses to produce the results
maxAssignments - the number of times the HIT can be accepted and completed before it becomes unavailable
Returns:
the created HIT
Throws:
ServiceException

createHIT

public com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.HIT createHIT(java.lang.String title,
                                                   java.lang.String description,
                                                   double reward,
                                                   java.lang.String question,
                                                   int maxAssignments,
                                                   boolean getFullResponse)
                                            throws ServiceException
Creates a HIT using defaults for the HIT properties not given as parameters.

Default values:

  • LifetimeInSeconds: 3 days
  • AssignmentDurationInSeconds: 1 hour
  • AutoApprovalDelayInSeconds: 15 days
  • Keywords: null
  • QualificationRequirement: null

Parameters:
title - the title of the HIT. The title appears in search results and everywhere the HIT is mentioned.
description - the description of the HIT. The description should include enough information for a Worker to evaluate the HIT before accepting it.
reward - the amount to pay for the completed HIT
question - the data the Worker uses to produce the results
maxAssignments - the number of times the HIT can be accepted and completed before it becomes unavailable
getFullResponse - if true, all information about the HIT is returned. If false, only HIT Id and HIT type Id are returned.
Returns:
the created HIT
Throws:
ServiceException

updateHIT

public java.lang.String updateHIT(java.lang.String hitId,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String description,
                                  java.lang.String keywords,
                                  java.lang.Double reward)
                           throws ServiceException
Updates a HIT with new title, description, keywords, and reward. If new values are not specified, the values from the original HIT are used. The following default values are used:
  • AssignmentDurationInSeconds: 1 hour
  • AutoApprovalDelayInSeconds: 15 days
  • QualificationRequirement: null

Parameters:
hitId - the Id of the HIT to update
title - the title of the updated HIT. If null, the current title of the HIT is used.
description - the description of the updated HIT. If null, the current description of the HIT is used.
keywords - one or more words or phrases to describe the updated HIT. If null, the current keywords are used.
reward - the amount to pay for the updated HIT when completed. If null, the the current reward of the HIT is used.
Returns:
the new HITType Id
Throws:
ServiceException

public java.lang.String[] updateHITs(java.lang.String[] hitIds,
                                     java.lang.String newHITTypeId)
                              throws ServiceException
Updates multiple HITs to a new HIT type.

Parameters:
hitIds - an array of Ids of HITs to update
newHITTypeId - the new HITTypeId
Returns:
array of hitIds that were successfully updated
Throws:
ServiceException

deleteHITs

public void deleteHITs(java.lang.String[] hitIds,
                       boolean approve,
                       boolean expire,
                       BatchItemCallback callback)
Deletes multiple HITs at one time.

Parameters:
hitIds - an array of Ids of HITs to delete
approve - specifies whether to approve assignments that have been submitted and have not been approved or rejected. Assignments that are in the review or reviewing states cannot be deleted.
expire - specifies whether to expire any HITs that are still available to Workers. Live HITs cannot be deleted.
callback - your callback method. This method is called asynchronously as each HIT is successfully deleted. This method can track the progress of the batch so you do not exit the process until the batch is completed.

extendHITs

public void extendHITs(java.lang.String[] hitIds,
                       java.lang.Integer maxAssignmentsIncrement,
                       java.lang.Long expirationIncrementInSeconds,
                       BatchItemCallback callback)
                throws ServiceException
Increases the maximum number of assignments, or extends the expiration date, of multiple HITs.

Parameters:
hitIds - an array of Ids of HITs to extend
maxAssignmentsIncrement - the number of assignments by which to increment the HIT's MaxAssignments property.
expirationIncrementInSeconds - the amount of time by which to extend the expiration date, in seconds.
callback - your callback method. This method is called asynchronously as each HIT is successfully extended. This method can track the progress of the batch so you do not exit the process until the batch is completed.
Throws:
ServiceException

approveAssignments

public void approveAssignments(java.lang.String[] assignmentIds,
                               java.lang.String[] requesterFeedback,
                               java.lang.String defaultFeedback,
                               BatchItemCallback callback)
                        throws ServiceException
Approves all assignments using the Axis worker thread pool.

Parameters:
assignmentIds - array of assignments to approve
requesterFeedback - feedback (comments) for the assignments
defaultFeedback - feedback used when no requesterFeedback is specified for an assignment ID
callback - your callback method. This method is called asynchronously as each HIT Assignment is successfully approved. This method can track the progress of the batch so you do not exit the process until the batch is completed.
Throws:
ServiceException

createQualificationType

public com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.QualificationType createQualificationType(java.lang.String name,
                                                                               java.lang.String keywords,
                                                                               java.lang.String description)
                                                                        throws ServiceException
Creates a Qualification type using default values for the properties not given as parameters. This method and assigns Test, AnswerKey, TestDurationInSeconds, AutoGranted, and AutoGrantedValue to null.

Parameters:
name - the name of the new Qualification type
keywords - one or more words or phrases that describe the Qualification type, separated by commas. A type's Keywords make the type easier to find using a search.
description - a long description for the Qualification type. This description is displayed when a user examines a Qualification type.
Returns:
the created QualificationType
Throws:
ServiceException

updateQualificationType

public com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.QualificationType updateQualificationType(java.lang.String qualificationTypeId,
                                                                               java.lang.String description,
                                                                               com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.QualificationTypeStatus status)
                                                                        throws ServiceException
Modifies the description and the status of an existing Qualification type. The Qualification is updated to use default values for all other parameters.

Parameters:
qualificationTypeId - the Id of the Qualification type to update
description - the new description of the Qualification type
status - the new status of the Qualification type. This value can be either Active or Inactive.
Returns:
the updated QualificationType
Throws:
ServiceException

getQualificationsForQualificationType

public com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.Qualification[] getQualificationsForQualificationType(java.lang.String qualificationTypeId,
                                                                                           int pageNum)
                                                                                    throws ServiceException
Retrieves all of the Qualifications granted to Workers for a given Qualification type. Results are divided into numbered "pages," and a single page of results is returned. This method uses the default page size of 10.

Parameters:
qualificationTypeId - the ID of the Qualification type to return.
pageNum - the page of results to return. Once the Qualifications have been filtered, sorted, and divided into pages, the page corresponding to pageNum is returned as the results.
Returns:
an array of Qualifications
Throws:
ServiceException

Returns:
an array of Assignments
Throws:
ServiceException

getAssignmentsForHIT

public com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.Assignment[] getAssignmentsForHIT(java.lang.String hitId,
                                                                       int pageNum,
                                                                       boolean getFullResponse)
                                                                throws ServiceException
Retrieves completed assignments for a HIT. You can get assignments for a HIT at any time, even if the HIT is not yet "reviewable". If a HIT has multiple assignments, and has received some results but has not yet become "reviewable", you can still retrieve the partial results with this method. The results are sorted by SubmitTime.

Parameters:
hitId - the Id of the HIT for which completed assignments are to be returned
pageNum - The page of results to return. Once the assignments have been filtered, sorted, and divided into pages, the page corresponding to pageNum is returned as the results of the operation.
getFullResponse - if true, all properties of the HIT are returned. If false, only the HIT Id and HIT type Id are returned.
Returns:
an array of Assignments
Throws:
ServiceException

                                           java.lang.String emailAddress,
                                           com.amazonaws.mturk.requester.EventType event)
Sets up email notification settings for the given HIT Type.

Parameters:
hitTypeId - the Id of the HIT type for which to send the notification
emailAddress - the email address to send the notification
event - the event that caused the notification. The possible events are:
  • AssignmentAccepted
  • AssignmentAbandoned
  • AssignmentReturned
  • AssignmentSubmitted
  • HITReviewable
  • HITExpired

ServiceException

getAnswerValue

public static java.lang.String getAnswerValue(java.lang.String assignmentId,
                                              com.amazonaws.mturk.dataschema.QuestionFormAnswersType.AnswerType answer)
Extracts the answer values from the given AnswerType object. When the answer type is Selections, this method returns the selections separated by the pipe character. When the answer type is UploadedFileKey, this method returns the S3 file key followed by the file's size in bytes.

Parameters:
assignmentId - The assignment for which the asnwers are extracted. If null, the upload URL might be invalid.
answer - the type of the answer
Returns:
a String representation of the answer
Throws:
ServiceException

getAnswerValue

public static java.lang.String getAnswerValue(java.lang.String assignmentId,
                                              com.amazonaws.mturk.dataschema.QuestionFormAnswersType.AnswerType answer,
                                              boolean includeQuestionId)
Extracts the answer values from the given AnswerType object. When the answer type is Selections, this method returns the selections separated by the pipe character. When the answer type is UploadedFileKey, this method returns the S3 file key followed by the file's size in bytes.

Parameters:
assignmentId - The assignment for which the answers are extracted. If null, the upload URL might be invalid.
answer - an AnswerType structure
includeQuestionId - specifies whether to prepend the answer with the associated QuestionIdentifier and a tab
Returns:
a String representation of the answer

                       BatchItemCallback callback)
Gets the results of HITs.

Parameters:
success - a success file that contains the HITs to get results for
callback - your callback method. This method is called asynchronously as each result is retrieved. This method can track the progress of the batch so you do not exit the process until the batch is completed.
